com.cerner.bunsen.codes

Class Hierarchies

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cerner.bunsen.codes.Hierarchies

  • public class Hierarchies
extends Object
    An immutable collection of hierarchical systems. This class is used to import ancestor content from hierarchical systems, explore it, and persist it to a database.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Hierarchies.HierarchicalElement
      A JavaBean to represent an element in a hierarchical system from which transitive ancestors can be computed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String ANCESTORS_TABLE
      Default table name where expanded ancestor information is stored.
      static String HIERARCHIES_DATABASE
      Default database name where the ancestor information is stored.
      static String HIERARCHY_URI_PREFIX
      A URI prefix for hierarchical systems.

      • ANCESTORS_TABLE

        public static final String ANCESTORS_TABLE
        Default table name where expanded ancestor information is stored.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HIERARCHY_URI_PREFIX

        public static final String HIERARCHY_URI_PREFIX
        A URI prefix for hierarchical systems. A Hierarchy URI is "complete" when an identifier suffix for the hierarchy is appended to this value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getAncestors

        public org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset<Ancestor> getAncestors()
        Returns a dataset of all ancestors in this collection. This is generally used for inspection and debugging of ancestors.
        Returns:
        a dataset of all ancestors.

      • getLatestVersions

        public Map<String,String> getLatestVersions()
        Returns the latest version of all hierarchies.
        Returns:
        a map of hierarchy URI to the latest version for that hierarchy.

      • getLatestVersions

        public Map<String,String> getLatestVersions(Set<String> uris)
        Returns latest versions of the given hierarchies.
        Parameters:
        uris - a set of URIs for which to retrieve the latest versions, or null to load them all
        Returns:
        a map of value set URIs to the latest versions for them.

      • withHierarchyElements

        public Hierarchies withHierarchyElements(String hierarchyUri,
                                         String hierarchyVersion,
                                         org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset<Hierarchies.HierarchicalElement> elements)
        Returns a new hierarchies instance with the transitive ancestors computed from the given dataset of Hierarchies.HierarchicalElement.
        Parameters:
        hierarchyUri - the URI of the hierarchical system to add
        hierarchyVersion - the version of the hierarchical system to add
        elements - the elements from which to calculate the ancestors
        Returns:
        an instance of Hierarchies with the ancestors computed from the given elements

      • withHierarchies

        public Hierarchies withHierarchies(Hierarchies hierarchies)
        Returns a new hierarchies instance with the given hierarchies.
        Parameters:
        hierarchies - the hierarchies to add to this instance
        Returns:
        a new instance of Hierarchies.

      • writeToDatabase

        public void writeToDatabase()
        Writes the ancestors to the default database "ontologies" using the default table "ancestors".

      • writeToDatabase

        public void writeToDatabase(String database)
        Writes the ancestors to the given database using the default table name "ancestors".
        Parameters:
        database - the name of the database to which the ancestors are saved

      • writeToTables

        public void writeToTables(String ancestorsTable)
        Writes the ancestors to the given table.

        Warning: these updates are likely not atomic due to the lack of transactional semantics in the underlying data store. Concurrent users may see previous items removed before new ones are added, or items appear separately than others. This is intended for use in a user-specific sandbox or staging environment.

        Parameters:
        ancestorsTable - the name of the table to which the ancestors are saved
